title: Twitter founder Jack Dorsey to be deposed in Twitter v. Musk case
description: Twitter co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey will be questioned on Tuesday morning by lawyers for the company and Elon Musk as part of the court fight over their $44 billion acquisition deal, according to a notice of a deposition filed Monday.

title: Donald Trump speaks at rally while music resembling a QAnon song plays
description: Music that sounded like a QAnon song was played during Donald Trump's speech at a rally in Ohio. CNN's Sara Sidner reports the details and other instances that show potential links between Donald Trump and QAnon propaganda.

title: Ex-prisoner describes harrowing torture from Russian captors
description: CNN's Nick Paton Walsh goes inside a recently abandoned building in Kupiansk, Ukraine, where Russians tortured Ukrainian prisoners, and speaks with a recently freed Ukrainian about his experience.

title: Ukrainian forces look to push counteroffensive farther east as military official warns: 'There will be a hard fight for every centimeter'
Ukrainian forces liberate village in Luhansk region, official says, as counteroffensive pushes farther east
4 out of 5 pregnancy-related deaths in the US are preventable, CDC finds
description: The vast majority of deaths among pregnant women and new mothers in the United States are preventable, according to a new report.

title: InSight lander detects space rocks as they slam into Mars
description: The NASA InSight Lander has "heard" and detected the vibrations of four space rocks as they slammed into Mars over the past two years.

title: Puerto Rico resident says Hurricane Fiona has devastated more homes than Maria
description: CNN's Leyla Santiago speaks to residents in San Juan, Puerto Rico, as Hurricane Fiona causes more than one million people to lose power.

title: What it was like to be part of the crowds at the Queen's funeral
description: CNN speaks to people who braved the tightly-packed crowds in central London to watch the funeral procession, saying goodbye to the longest-reigning British monarch.

title: Watch: Teacher rescues owl from soccer net
description: Middle school science teacher Abby Ward sprang into action to help untangle an owl from a soccer net on River View Middle School's field as students and teachers stood by and watched. Ward shares the thoughts that were running through her mind during the rescue.

title: Scars of Russia's brutal occupation remain in Kharkiv
description: There is little respite in victory for Ukrainian forces in the recently liberated Kupiansk. Russian shells still hit its pockmarked streets, marring the skyline with plumes of black smoke.

title: Lady Gaga breaks down in tears after stopping concert
description: The singer abruptly stopped the final show of the Chromatic Ball tour because of bad weather in Miami. The tour was delayed for two years due to Covid.

title: See which royal pets made appearances at Queen Elizabeth II's funeral
description: Queen Elizabeth II made sure her furry friends were in attendance at the committal service held at Windsor Castle. CNN's Don Lemon speaks with a panel about the important role the royal pets played in the life of the late British monarch.

title: Why we grieve for people we don't know
description: The death of Queen Elizabeth II has prompted public displays of grief around the world -- from public gatherings at Buckingham Palace in London, and condolences from world leaders, to individuals reflecting on social media about what she meant to them.

title: Russia escalates attacks on critical facilities as Zelensky says Ukraine 'preparing for liberation of more cities'
'She sat for him 12 times': The Nigerian artist who made a bronze sculpture of Queen Elizabeth II
description: The year was 1956, and there was much fanfare and anticipation for Queen Elizabeth's first visit to Nigeria.

title: Blake Lively shares pregnancy pics to thwart paparazzi
description: Blake Lively decided that if anyone was going to share her pregnancy photos it was going to be her.

title: Webb telescope shares its first observations of bright Mars
description: The James Webb Space Telescope's main goal is to detect faint light from distant galaxies, but it recently observed one of the brightest objects in the night sky: Mars.

title: Hear the choir as Queen Elizabeth's coffin enters St. George's Chapel
description: The coffin bearers for Queen Elizabeth II carry the coffin into St. George's Chapel at Windsor Castle where the committal service takes place as members of choir perform.

title: House lawmakers lay out proposal for legislation to prevent another January 6
description: GOP Rep. Liz Cheney of Wyoming and Democratic Rep. Zoe Lofgren of California previewed in an op-ed their proposed legislation to make it harder to overturn a certified presidential election in the future by proposing changes to the Electoral Count Act.

title: Funeral procession arrives in Windsor ahead of committal service
description: CNN anchor and royal correspondent Max Foster explains who's who in the funeral procession as they walk behind Queen Elizabeth II's coffin towards Windsor for the final time.

title: Drone footage shows scale of destruction after Taiwan earthquake
description: The Gaoliao Bridge, in the eastern Hualien County, collapsed after a 6.9-magnitude earthquake struck the Asian island on September 18.

title: Much of Puerto Rico without power and flooded as Fiona moves on Dominican Republic
description: Rescuers are scrambling to save flooding victims in Puerto Rico after Hurricane Fiona wiped out power to most of the island and then slammed into the Dominican Republic.

title: Royal journalist on what it was like inside Queen's funeral
description: Royal journalist, Emily Nash, describes Queen Elizabeth's funeral as 'extraordinary' and 'exceptionally special' after attending her funeral.

title: Why the Royal Vault isn't the Queen's final resting place
description: • Follow along: Order of service for the Queen's committal

title: 'Queer Eye' star Karamo Brown debuts new talk show
description: Karamo Brown's new talk show, "Karamo," debuts Monday.

title: Donald Trump humiliated J.D. Vance for fun
description: Donald Trump needs you to know that Republican candidates don't just like him, they love him. And they need him. Badly.

title: 'L.A. Confidential' at 25: The movie that should have sunk 'Titanic'
description: Movies are about more than awards, but the films that walk away with Oscars is one of the way of distinguishing years in everything from time-capsule radio contests to greeting cards.

title: Hong Kong's colorful new 'pocket parks' are revitalizing public spaces
description: Bright pink and scattered with octagonal stools, Portland Street Rest Garden is an Instagrammer's dream. But this park, wedged between two high rises on a bustling Hong Kong street, isn't filled with influencers posing for photos: instead, local retirees play checkers on fuchsia gameboards, while elderly neighbors gossip on the rose-colored benches, purple grass swaying in the planters behind.

title: 'Quantum Leap' gets a modest upgrade as it takes the plunge again on NBC
description: The process of trying to advance the original story and simultaneously replicate it becomes a jump that initially appears beyond the reach of "Quantum Leap," an NBC redo of one of the more provocative concepts from the network's golden years. Situated after "The Voice," the series seems destined to get a look from viewers, but despite a serialized mystery, that won't prevent some from jumping out just as quickly.

title: Watch live: CNN's coverage of the Queen's state funeral
Why the current oil boom for Arab states may be their last
Lea Michele mocks rumor that she's illiterate
description: Lea Michele has leaned into being a "Funny Girl."

title: Judge set to determine if the conviction of 'Serial' subject Adnan Syed will be vacated
description: A court hearing Monday could determine whether to vacate the murder conviction of Adnan Syed, the subject of the popular "Serial" podcast that reexamined his case.

title: Tom Brady throws tablet to ground, involved in scuffle in nervy Bucs win
description: Tom Brady snapped the Tampa Bay Buccaneers' seven-game losing streak against the New Orleans Saints as his side overcame a fraught game filled with scuffles and frayed nerves to seal a 20-10 victory in Louisiana.

title: Joe Biden's 2024 answer leaves a whole lot of wiggle room
description: Joe Biden was asked a very simple question in an interview that aired Sunday: Had he decided whether to run again for president in 2024?

title: Piper, who woke the Queen up every morning, played her to rest
Robert Shiller: Fed risks 'disgrace' if it doesn't control inflation
description: Central banks are faced with the unenviable task of trying to put a lid on decades-high inflation without triggering harsh recessions that could unleash misery around the world. But Robert Shiller, a Nobel Prize-winning economist at Yale University, thinks they have no choice but to hold the line.

title: King Charles leaves handwritten note on top of the Queen's coffin
description: The note on top of Queen Elizabeth II's coffin during her funeral on Monday was a handwritten message from her son, King Charles III.

title: Black hats and brooches: Funeral guests wear quiet tributes to Elizabeth
description: The late Queen Elizabeth II was a master of symbolic dressing, using clothes, colors, hats and jewels to communicate with subjects and conduct soft diplomacy. On Monday, as Britain's longest-reigning monarch was laid to rest, it was time for her admirers -- family members, heads of states and other dignitaries -- to do the same.

title: The country that is showing the world how to save water
description: Scorching temperatures and reports of water scarcity are grabbing headlines, as drought caused by climate change creates long-term problems for farmers and communities in the United States and around the world. Without adequate supply of water, farmers are being forced to plant less in order to conserve the water they will need to get through yet another year of prolonged drought. The consequences will be higher food prices here, but also social instability in countries important to the US.

title: Racist chanting mars Real Madrid's 2-1 derby victory over Atlético Madrid
description: Racist chanting from a group of Atlético Madrid fans towards Real Madrid player Vinícius Jr. was caught on camera ahead of the Madrid derby on Sunday.

title: Aaron Judge hits two HRs to reach 59 on the year, edges closer to Roger Maris' 61
description: New York Yankees superstar Aaron Judge hit two home runs to reach 59 on the season -- the most ever for a right-hander in American League (AL) history -- in a monster performance on Sunday afternoon in Milwaukee as the Yankees beat the Brewers 12-8.

title: American held captive in Afghanistan for more than 2 years is released, source says
description: President Joe Biden has informed the family of an American held in captive in Afghanistan that he was released and is on an aircraft out of the country, according to a source familiar with the matter.

title: Livestream: Watch CNN's coverage of the Queen's state funeral
Family join procession bringing Queen's coffin to funeral
description: • Why a gun carriage is used to carry the Queen

title: California woman who faked her own kidnapping set to be sentenced today
description: The California woman who faked her own kidnapping in 2016 in a hoax that was exposed with the help of advances in DNA technology is set to be sentenced on Monday.

title: Celtic fans disrupt minute's applause for Queen Elizabeth II with anti-Royal chanting and banner
description: Supporters of Glasgow-based football team Celtic FC chanted anti-royal sentiments during a planned minute's applause for Queen Elizabeth II ahead of the team's match against St. Mirren in Paisley, Scotland, on Sunday.

title: Special role: Prince George and Princess Charlotte to walk in Queen's funeral procession
description: Prince George and Princess Charlotte will have a special role at the state funeral of their late great-grandmother, Queen Elizabeth II, on Monday.

title: Previously unseen photo of smiling Queen revealed ahead of state funeral
description: Beaming at the camera, a joyous Queen Elizabeth II smiles in a photograph newly released by Buckingham Palace on the eve of her state funeral.

title: Trump ally goes on trial for 'espionage lite' and obstruction
description: Jury selection begins Monday in the trial of a former Donald Trump adviser whom authorities allege was involved in a two-year effort to try to influence the policy decisions of the Trump campaign and administration to benefit the United Arab Emirates.

title: The Orders of Service for Queen Elizabeth II's state funeral and committal service
Paul Pogba's brother detained over alleged extortion, says lawyer
description: Mathias Pogba, the brother of France's World Cup-winning footballer Paul Pogba, has been put under temporary detention by a Paris court as it investigates allegations of extortion, his lawyer has confirmed to CNN.

title: Ethan Nwaneri: Who is the Arsenal schoolboy who made Premier League history?
description: With victory all but secured, Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta gave the nod to the substitutes' bench. Changes were afoot, history would be made.

title: How to watch Queen Elizabeth II's state funeral on TV
description: The state funeral for Queen Elizabeth II will take place on Monday in London, in an occasion that will mark the world's farewell to Britain's longest-reigning monarch.

title: The funeral of Queen Elizabeth II
Ukraine consolidates liberated territories as tense fighting continues in south
The funeral of Queen Elizabeth II
Biden and world leaders set to attend funeral
description: US President Joe Biden will join a long slate of world leaders on Monday for Queen Elizabeth II's state funeral inside London's Westminster Abbey, where royal pageantry will be on full display to pay tribute to a monarch whose rule spanned seven decades.

title: Britain bids farewell to Queen Elizabeth with an outpouring of emotion
Would US forces defend Taiwan if China invades? Biden again says, 'yes'
description: President Joe Biden has reiterated that United States military personnel would defend Taiwan if the Chinese military were to launch an invasion of the democratically ruled island.

title: Thousands are expected to line the streets as the country holds a historic state funeral for Britain's longest-reigning monarch
Biden equivocates on 2024 as Republicans send culture wars into overdrive
description: If America's angry politics were not jumbled enough, President Joe Biden just injected new uncertainty into a head-spinning midterm election ride.

title: Oktoberfest returns after two-year hiatus
description: The annual Oktoberfest, the world's largest beer festival, kicked off on Saturday for the first time since 2019, marking the end of a two-year hiatus as a result of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Air New Zealand connects Auckland and New York for the first time ever
description: After 16 hours in the sky, Air New Zealand's first ever direct flight to New York City arrived at JFK airport on September 17.

title: Severe power outages as Typhoon Nanmadol travels towards Tokyo
description: More than 300,000 households across southwestern Japan have been left without power after Typhoon Nanmadol made landfall late on Sunday, prompting local authorities to issue a "special warning" urging residents to seek shelter from the powerful storm.

title: Mechanics fined, suspended for blocking opposing team's bike from leaving pit
description: Two mechanics have been fined and suspended for blocking an opposing team's bike from leaving the pit lane during qualifying for a motorbike race.

title: Putin calls for de-escalation as Kyrgyz-Tajik border conflict death toll nears 100
description: Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan said on Sunday nearly 100 people had died in their border conflict, as a fragile ceasefire between the Central Asian nations extended into a second day and their mutual ally Russia urged a de-escalation.

title: A brief history of Britain's royal mourning dress codes
description: Out of respect for Queen Elizabeth II, members of the British royal family will be adhering to a somber dress code for Monday's state funeral.

title: Winter is fast approaching in Ukraine. Here's what comes next for the conflict
How many GOP candidates doubted Biden's win? Here's what we found
description: CNN's Daniel Dale takes a closer look at the Republican candidates running for the senate and state house to see how many of them publicly doubted that President Joe Biden won the 2020 election or worked behind the scenes to challenge the results.

title: Ex-Republican lawmaker reacts to Trump's 'humiliating' speech
description: Former Congresswoman Barbara Comstock (R-VA) joins CNN's Jim Acosta to react to former President Trump's speech at a rally supporting GOP Senate candidate JD Vance in Ohio.

title: Opinion: Republicans just gave the country a master class on extremism
description: Some leading Republicans gave Americans a master class on extremism this past week by repeatedly reminding us about the threat they pose to our freedoms and our democracy.

title: DeSantis gets standing ovation from GOP voters after flying migrants to Martha's Vineyard
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis, speaking in Kansas on Sunday, gave every indication he intends to capitalize on the latest wave of attention that has followed from him sending migrants to Massachusetts last week.

title: 27 people dead, 20 injured after Covid quarantine bus overturns in China, local authorities say
description: A bus transferring dozens of people to a Covid-19 quarantine facility in China's southwestern province of Guizhou overturned in a ravine early Sunday morning, killing 27 and injuring 20, local authorities said in a news briefing.

title: Biden: 'The pandemic is over'
